description: Numbers n with property that every digit is a prime factor of n.
comments: This is a regular language in base 10. Almost all members of this sequence are multiples of either 42 or 105. There are about 2/63 * 3^n members of this sequence up to 10^n. [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 09 2011]
links: Harry J. Smith and Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms from Smith)
mathematica: Select[Range[2, 50000], Complement[IntegerDigits[#], FactorInteger[#][[All, 1]]] == {} &] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Dec 05 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) { n=0; for (m=1, 10^10, t=m; b=1; while (t>0, d=t%10; t=(t-d)/10; if (!isprime(d) || m%d, b=0; break)); if (b, write("b062239.txt", n++, " ", m); if (n==1000, return)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Feb 17 2010]
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jun 30 2001
